channelId.description: Channel containing the message. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

include_labels.description: Whether to include labels for each ID in custom profile fields

user.description: User to retrieve profile info for

userIds.description: The ID of the user to invite into channel. Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression.

userId.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

returnAll.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

limit.description: Max number of results to return

channelId.description: Channel containing the file to be listed. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

showFilesHidden.description: Whether to show truncated file info for files hidden due to being too old, and the team who owns the file being over the file limit

tsFrom.description: Filter files created after this timestamp (inclusive)

tsTo.description: Filter files created before this timestamp (inclusive)

userId.description: Filter files created by a single user. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

resolveData.description: Whether to resolve the data automatically. By default the response only contain the ID to resource.

channelIds.description: The channels to send the file to. Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression.

initialComment.description: The message text introducing the file in specified channels

threadTs.description: Provide another message's ts value to upload this file as a reply. Never use a reply's ts value; use its parent instead.

name.description: A name for the User Group. Must be unique among User Groups.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message to be updated

topic.description: The new topic string. Does not support formatting or linkification.

channel.description: The channel to send the message to

user.description: The ID of the user to get the online status of

text.description: New text for the message, using the default formatting rules. It's not required when presenting attachments.

icon_emoji.description: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. Overrides icon_url.

icon_url.description: URL to an image to use as the icon for this message

link_names.description: Whether to find and link channel names and usernames

thread_ts.description: Provide another message's ts value to make this message a reply

mrkdwn.description: Whether to use Slack Markdown parsing

reply_broadcast.description: Whether the reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Use in conjunction with thread_ts.

unfurl_links.description: Whether to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content

unfurl_media.description: Whether to disable unfurling of media content

sendAsUser.description: The message will be sent from this username (i.e. as if this individual sent the message).

fallback.description: Required plain-text summary of the attachment

color.description: Color of the line left of text

pretext.description: Text which appears before the message block

author_icon.description: Icon which should appear for the user

footer_icon.description: Icon which should appear next to footer

short.description: Whether items can be displayed next to each other

channels.description: A comma-separated string of encoded channel IDs for which the User Group uses as a default. Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression.

description.description: A short description of the User Group

handle.description: A mention handle. Must be unique among channels, users and User Groups.

include_count.description: Whether to include the number of users in each User Group

name.description: A name for the User Group. Must be unique among User Groups.

blockId.description: A string acting as a unique identifier for a block. You can use this block_id when you receive an interaction payload to identify the source of the action. If not specified, a block_id will be generated. Maximum length for this field is 255 characters.

emoji.description: Whether emojis in a text field should be escaped into the colon emoji format

actionId.description: An identifier for this action. You can use this when you receive an interaction payload to identify the source of the action. Should be unique among all other action_ids used elsewhere by your app.

url.description: A URL to load in the user's browser when the button is clicked. Maximum length for this field is 3000 characters. If you're using URL, you'll still receive an interaction payload and will need to send an acknowledgement response.

value.description: The value to send along with the interaction payload

style.description: Decorates buttons with alternative visual color schemes

confirmUi.description: Defines an optional confirmation dialog after the button is clicked

emoji.description: Whether emojis in a text field should be escaped into the colon emoji format

textUi.description: Defines the explanatory text that appears in the confirm dialog

emoji.description: Whether emojis in a text field should be escaped into the colon emoji format

confirmTextUi.description: Defines the text of the button that confirms the action

text.description: Defines the explanatory text that appears in the confirm dialog

emoji.description: Whether emojis in a text field should be escaped into the colon emoji format

denyUi.description: Defines the text of the button that cancels the action

text.description: Defines the text of the button that cancels the action

emoji.description: Whether emojis in a text field should be escaped into the colon emoji format

style.description: Defines the color scheme applied to the confirm button

textUi.description: Define the text of the button that cancels the action

type.description: The formatting to use for this text object

text.description: The text for the block. This field accepts any of the standard text formatting markup when type is mrkdwn.

emoji.description: Whether emojis in a text field should be escaped into the colon emoji format. This field is only usable when type is plain_text.

verbatim.description: Whether to set to false (as is default) URLs will be auto-converted into links, conversation names will be link-ified, and certain mentions will be automatically parsed

fieldsUi.description: An array of text objects. Any text objects included with fields will be rendered in a compact format that allows for 2 columns of side-by-side text. Maximum number of items is 10.

type.description: The formatting to use for this text object

text.description: The text for the block. This field accepts any of the standard text formatting markup when type is mrkdwn.

emoji.description: Whether emojis in a text field should be escaped into the colon emoji format. This field is only usable when type is plain_text.

verbatim.description: When set to false (as is default) URLs will be auto-converted into links, conversation names will be link-ified, and certain mentions will be automatically parsed

emoji.description: Whether emojis in a text field should be escaped into the colon emoji format

actionId.description: An identifier for this action. You can use this when you receive an interaction payload to identify the source of the action. Should be unique among all other action_ids used elsewhere by your app.

url.description: A URL to load in the user's browser when the button is clicked. Maximum length for this field is 3000 characters. If you're using URL, you'll still receive an interaction payload and will need to send an acknowledgement response.

value.description: The value to send along with the interaction payload

style.description: Decorates buttons with alternative visual color schemes

confirmUi.description: Defines an optional confirmation dialog after the button is clicked

titleUi.description: Defines an optional confirmation dialog after the button is clicked

emoji.description: Whether emojis in a text field should be escaped into the colon emoji format

textUi.description: Defines the explanatory text that appears in the confirm dialog

emoji.description: Whether emojis in a text field should be escaped into the colon emoji format

confirmTextUi.description: Defines the explanatory text that appears in the confirm dialog

text.description: Defines the explanatory text that appears in the confirm dialog

emoji.description: Whether emojis in a text field should be escaped into the colon emoji format

denyUi.description: Define the text of the button that cancels the action

text.description: Define the text of the button that cancels the action

emoji.description: Whether emojis in a text field should be escaped into the colon emoji format

style.description: Defines the color scheme applied to the confirm button

binaryData.description: Whether the data to upload should be taken from binary field

fileContent.description: The text content of the file to upload

userGroupId.description: The encoded ID of the User Group to update
